data.title: By default 6 instances of VS code opens
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open vs code from shortcut or start menu or anywhere else.

Expected - only 1 instance should open.

Actual- 6 instances opens automatically.

data.title: Markdown preview line sync is reset when writing
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1 (1.10.2 too)
- OS Version: Win7
- Extension for markdown : 
auto-open markdown / markdown shortcut / markdown pdf / markdownlint

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a markdown file and write enought text to activate the scroll
2. Click somewhere and see the preview be syncronize on the same line
3. Write something
=> The preview will go to the beginning of the file

Each letter I write, the preview go to the correct line then back to the begin of the preview

data.title: debug console output
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run this program in legacy debugger:
  ```js
   for (var i=0; i < 100; i++) {
	process.stdout.write(`${i} `);
   }
  ```

Observe:
- First two lines are green
- output is split into separate lines (instead of one long line)

![2017-02-10_10-47-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22822207/b79dc93a-ef7e-11e6-8f66-49567f351a59.png)

data.title: Visual code window does not seem to be active window
data.body:
Hi,
When we open Visual code, its title bar should be shown in blue color because it is an active window. However, the title bar shows gray color even though it is made active window.
-Anand Kulkarni

data.title: Cannot add folder to root if only folders exist
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:31:51.320Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.1|
|sublime-babel-vscode|joshpeng|0.2.4|
|vs-keybindings|ms-vscode|0.1.3|
|vscode-open|sandcastle|0.1.0|
|preview-vscode|searKing|1.1.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an empty folder 
2. Create a new folder from the explorer new folder button
3. Attempt to create a new sibling folder at the root using the new folder button
4. Folder is created as a child of the first new folder
5. There is no way to select the root as the parent and add a folder from the explorer new folder button

data.title: [loc][Query][VSCode] Please conform translatability
data.body:
Hi, we have a question from our translator. Can you help please? Thanks!

Source:
Controls the dimensions of opening a new window. By default, a new window will open in the center of the screen with small dimensions. When set to  'inherit', the window will get the same dimensions as the last active one. When set to 'maximized', the window will open maximized and fullscreen if configured to 'fullscreen'.

File Name:
src\vs\workbench\electron-browser\main.contribution.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "newWindowDimensions"

Query:
Please confirm "inherit", "maximized" and "fullscreen" are to be translated.

data.title: [loc][Query][VSCode] Please clarify the string
data.body:
Hi, we have a question from our translator. Can you help please? Thanks!

Source:
Controls if files should open in a new window or the last active window.\n- default: files will open in the last active window unless opened via the dock or from finder (macOS only)\n- on: files will open in a new window\n- off: files will open in the last active window\nNote that there can still be cases where this setting is ignored (e.g. when using the -new-window or -reuse-window command line option).

Controls if folders should open in a new window or replace the last active window.\n- default: folders will open in a new window unless a folder is picked from within the application (e.g. via the File menu)\n- on: folders will open in a new window\n- off: folders will replace the last active window\nNote that there can still be cases where this setting is ignored (e.g. when using the -new-window or -reuse-window command line option).

Controls the position of the editor's tabs close buttons or disables them when set to 'off'.

File Name:
src\vs\workbench\electron-browser\main.contribution.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "openFilesInNewWindow"
".resx", 0; "openFoldersInNewWindow"
".resx", 0; "editorTabCloseButton"

Query:
Please confirm "default", "on" and "off" are to be translated. Please what "dock" and "finder" refer to here and confirm their their translatability.

data.title: `.deb` package fails linting on Debian

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When opening a `.deb` package using GDebi (0.9.5.3ubuntu2), you have the option to see _Lintian output_. 
This raises a bunch of warnings and some errors, mostly to do with executable permission on files that shouldn't be executable. 

- VSCode Version: `code_1.9.1-1486597190_amd64.deb`, `code-insiders_1.10.0-1486640887_amd64.deb`
- OS Version: Linux Mint 17.3 Rosa

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Double-click `.deb` to open the package in GDebi 
2. and visit the _Lintian output_ tab.

Sample output:

```
E: code: shlib-with-executable-bit usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/gc-signals/build/Release/gcsignals.node 0755
E: code: shlib-with-executable-bit usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/gc-signals/build/Release/obj.target/gcsignals.node 0755
E: code: shlib-with-executable-bit usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/native-keymap/build/Release/keymapping.node 0755
E: code: shlib-with-executable-bit usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/native-keymap/build/Release/obj.target/keymapping.node 0755
E: code: shlib-with-executable-bit usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/node-pty/build/Release/pty.node 0755
E: code: shlib-with-executable-bit usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/oniguruma/build/Release/obj.target/onig_scanner.node 0755
E: code: shlib-with-executable-bit usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/oniguruma/build/Release/onig_scanner.node 0755
E: code: shlib-with-executable-bit usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/vsda/build/Release/vsda_linux64.node 0755

Lintian finished with exit status 1
```

data.title: SCM: make git commit box look like other input boxes (font, color)
data.body:
I think we should use the same font we e.g. also use for the search input box. Also the same background color:

data.title: Can't open this git resource: Merge Added conflicts

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

I cannot open the conflict files when clicking on the git side bar
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: #83-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jan 18 14:10:15 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
 - git version 2.7.4
 - plugins: lukehoban.Go
Steps to Reproduce:

1. some how make a merge conflict
2. click on the file name


![conflict](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1708320/22817115/0b02e0c4-ef98-11e6-9ab2-4f9db078e212.png)
